p: Diffraction structures holographically formed in composite photopolymer materials (containing monomer, dye, initiator, plasticizer, etc.) are well known since 1960s–1970s [ 1, 2, 3]. In the same period, H. Kogelnik published an article [ 4] with the coupled waves theory for the light diffraction on bulk phase gratings. The first theoretical models of diffraction structures’ holographic formation in such media appeared somewhat later [ 5, 6].
